title: Rivers o Feden on the Prologue of John (In Depth)
description:
Here is the introduction video that should be watched first: https://youtu.be/azSNgWEv6R0

Rivers o Feden is a self taught bible student who is very good at Greek. He has a very interesting interpretation of the prologue of gospel of John. In this conversation we do a in depth examination of his interpretation of the prologue and how that fits into the larger picture of the gospel. Rivers' interpretation is compatible with a Biblical Unitarian understanding of Jesus but it is different than the way most Unitarians have interpreted the prologue in recent times. In this episode I dig deeper with Rivers and we go through the prologue verse by verse.

0:00:00 - Introduction
0:01:30 - v01 - "In the beginning"
0:06:45 - v01 - "Logos"
0:17:55 - v01 - "Was with God"
0:30:00 - v01 - "God"
0:31:10 - v01 - "Word was God"
0:43:00 - v02 - "Houtos"
0:52:15 - v03 - "All things"
0:54:55 - v03 - "Egeneto"
1:01:50 - v03 - "Without him was not any thing"
1:07:15 - v04 - "Life"
1:10:00 - v04 - "Autou"
1:12:00 - v04 - "Life"
1:14:25 - v05 - "Light shines in the darkness"
1:18:45 - v05 - "Darkness did not comprehend"
1:23:00 - v06 - "Sent from God"
1:23:50 - v06 - "Whose name was John"
1:24:20 - v07 - "He came as a witness"
1:28:00 - v09 - "True light"
1:29:45 - v10 - "Cosmos"
1:39:49 - v13 - "Born"
1:50:00 - v14 - "Word became flesh"
1:59:25 - v14 - "Glory"
2:08:40 - v14 - "Monogenes"
2:11:40 - v14 - "Full of grace and truth"
2:13:55 - v15 - "He was before me"
2:24:50 - v17 - "The law was given through Moses"
2:29:50 - v18 - "Only begotten god"
2:35:00 - v18 - "No one has seen god"
2:40:40 - v18 - "He has made him known"
2:43:10 - v18 - "Is in the bosom of the Father"
2:46:00 - v08 - "Recapping thoughts on autou"
2:49:00 - Closing remarks
